Docs.summary: Represents a row within a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow> class is used to represent an individual row in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control. Each row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control has a designated row type. The following table lists the different row types.
|Row type|Description| |--------------|-----------------| |`DataControlRowType.DataRow`|The data row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control.| |`DataControlRowType.EmptyDataRow`|The empty data row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control. The empty data row is displayed in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control when there are no records to display.| |`DataControlRowType.Footer`|The footer row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control.| |`DataControlRowType.Header`|The header row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control.| |`DataControlRowType.Pager`|A pager row in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control.|
To determine the row type of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow> object, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow.RowType%2A> property. A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow> object also has a state associated with it. The state can be a bitwise combination of the values in the following table.
|State value|Description| |-----------------|-----------------| |`DataControlRowState.Edit`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow> object is in edit mode.| |`DataControlRowState.Insert`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow> object is in insert mode.| |`DataControlRowState.Normal`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow> object is in its normal (default) state.| |`DataControlRowState.Selected`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow> object is selected.|
To determine the state of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow> object, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow.RowState%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView> control displays the contents of its <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView.ItemTemplate%2A> property in a data row. To access the data row, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormView.Row%2A> property. To determine the index of the current data item in the data source, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow.ItemIndex%2A> property.
You can access the individual cells of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow> object by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow.Cells%2A> property. If a cell contains controls, you can retrieve a control from the cell by using one of the following methods:
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.Controls%2A> collection of the cell to retrieve the control at a specific index.
- Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.FindControl%2A> method of the cell to retrieve the control, if the control has its <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> property set. This is the preferred method to retrieve a control from a cell.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow> class, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to retrieve an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Image> control from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow> object that represents the item row. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Image> controls are declared in the edit and item templates.

## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow.RowState%2A> property to determine the state of the row. The state can be a bitwise combination of the values in the following table.
|State value|Description| |-----------------|-----------------| |`DataControlRowState.Edit`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow> object is in edit mode.| |`DataControlRowState.Insert`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow> object is in insert mode.| |`DataControlRowState.Normal`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow> object is in its normal, read-only state.| |`DataControlRowState.Selected`|The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.FormViewRow> object is selected.|
This property is commonly used to determine the state of a row before performing an operation.
